intro: Adenanthos oreophilus, commonly known as the mountain adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in woodland or heathland environments. It is well adapted to dry conditions and can withstand periods of drought. Adenanthos oreophilus is often found in elevated areas, such as slopes and hillsides, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
